We stumbled upon this place on our way to the Museu de Picasso.  A local recommended it and said it was the best tapas restaurant in Barcelona.  The service, without a doubt, was fantastic.  They were sooo friendly and super helpful in recommending pairings and picking dishes for us based on our culinary preferences.I really liked the cream cheese-stuffed cherry tomato, tuna in oil, and cheesy baked-potato-like tapa.  Tasty, but overpriced, like all tapas.  Nothing to write home about. Next!
